titleStmt.title: SII 3.109: original edition by H. Krishna Sastri
No. 109.—ON THE NORTH WALL OF THE LAKSHMINARAYANA-PERUMAL TEMPLE AT SINNAMANUR. No. 443 of 1907.

summary.p: The inscription is dated in the 36th year of Parakēsarivarman and is much damaged. It is written in the Vaṭṭeḻuttu alphabet and registers a gift of a lamp to the temple of Tirunaḍuvūr [in] Arukēsarinallūr (which was the ancient name of Śiṉṉamaṉūr), a brahmadēya in Aḻa-nāḍu. The high regnal year points to the king being identical with Parāntaka I. If this is the case, an inscription of Parāntaka I. so far to the south of Madura deserves to be noted.

revisionDesc.change: Further conversion of digital encoding to DHARMA encoding scheme according to EGD (Encoding Guide for Diplomatic Editions)
Conversion of digital encoding to DHARMA encoding scheme according to EGD (Encoding Guide for Diplomatic Editions)

div.p:
svasti śrī . kopparakecarivaṉmarkku yāṇṭu muppa
ttāṟāvatu Ivvāṇṭu Aḻanāṭṭup pi
ramateyam Arukecarinallūrt tirunaṭuvūr paṭāra
rkkut tiruviḷakkuneykku nicati tirucce
tiirācaṭi taṉ makaṉ Irācaṭicolaiyaic cārttiThe inscription is incomplete.

Hail ! Prosperity ! The 36th year of (the reign of) king Parakēsarivarman. In this year • • per day for the ghee (which is required) for (one) sacred lamp to the god (bhaṭāra) of Tirunaḍuvūr in Arukēsarinallūr, a brahmadēya of Aḻa-nāḍu, by Tiruchchēdi Irāśaḍi, on behalf of his son Irāśaḍi Śōlai.
Digital edition of SII 3.109 by converted to DHARMA conventions by Emmanuel Francis.
